about: A quick summary of what the bot is and does.
dmroll: Roll a die such that only the DM can see the result. Will only work if someone has the "DM" role. See the help for "roll" for syntax.
gmroll: Roll a die such that only the DM can see the result. Will only work if someone has the "DM" role. See the help for "roll" for syntax.
hello: Say hi to me! I'll say hi back.
help: Use "--help <command>" to get help about a specific command
kick: User "--kick <mention>" to disconnect someone you don't like.
magic:
Search for Magic cards as follows:
Find a [card] like this.
Find a specific [printing|like this]
Get a [random] card.
minecraft: Submit a vote to reboot the minecraft server. Usage: "--minecraft reboot".
roll:
Roll a die. Syntax: `<quantity>d<size><a or d> k<amount> +<mod>`. Alternately, view stats on your rolls with "--roll stats". You can reset your stats for this server with "--roll reset server stats" or for all servers with "--roll reset stats". Some roll examples:
	`--roll d20a`: roll a d20 with advantage.
	`--roll 4d6k3`: roll 4d6, keeping the 3 highest.
	`--roll 2d4 + 2 1d6 + 3`: roll 2d4 and add 2, roll a d6 and add 3.
	`--roll d8 * 12 / 6 / 2d4 + 3`: roll a d8, multiply the result by 12 and divide it by 6, then divide this by the result of rolling 2d4 and adding 3.
setdm: This command can only by used by the current DM, and sets a different user as the DM.
spell: Find information on a Dungeons and Dragons spell. Usage: "--spell <spell name>".
vw: Convert the input text into unicode wide text. Usage: "--vw <text>".
wa: Convert the input text into emoji wordart. A default emoji will be used or to use a different emoji you may include it in the text of your message. Usage: "--wa <text>".
weeb: Let someone know what you think of them after a JoJo reference.
xkcd: User "--xkcd <comic name>" or "--xkcd <comic number> to grab an xkcd comic. Alternately, use "--xkcd random" for a random comic, or "--xkcd newest" for the most recent comic.
You can use this command to get help about specific commands with "--help <command>". To see a list of commands, try "--all". To see how to find Magic cards, try "--help magic".
